Incidentally, I also offered, should affirmative action
on the ETRC’b application be delayed for procedural reasons,
that NAEB would be glad to distribute temporarily European
programs to its members, who include most of ETRC’s members*
I hope you approve! If you do not, then don’t hesitate
to disavow my action. If you do, let’s see that the right
people learn of it, so that we gain full credit for my
generous, perhaps rash, and admittedly unauthorized action.
Apropos of all this, I should state that the ETRC and
anyone else who is considering using continental European
television films should scrutinize them carefully before
televising them. The samples I saw at the URI meeting in
Paris, as well as here, were pretty sad*
Here is a matter on which I will need briefing before
the Rome EBU meeting of May 27-28 (but for which I shall be
leaving London on Kay 19). In Paris Mr. Zaffrani of RAI
asked me, what about NAEB and the Prix Italia. I gave no
reply, but said I would ask for instructions. Could I have
some guidance? What have been our relations with the Prix
Italia this year? What will they be in the future?
I have scheduled meetings with the Swedish radio people
on radio programs for NAEB. When these are completed, I’ll
report on them.
Best wishes to you all.
BPsds
